member.name: T:Project.Web.Controllers.AdminController
member.summary: Controller for administrative operations including dashboard statistics, audit logs, and business verification management.
member.remarks: All endpoints in this controller require Admin role authorization.

member.name: M:Project.Web.Controllers.AdminController.#ctor(Project.Core.ServiceContracts.IAdminService,Project.Core.ServiceContracts.IBusinessService,FluentValidation.IValidator{Project.Core.DTO.ReviewBusinessDTO})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Service for handling admin-specific operations.
Service for handling business-related operations.
Validator for business review operations.

member.name: M:Project.Web.Controllers.AdminController.GetDashboardStats
member.summary: Retrieves comprehensive dashboard statistics for the admin panel.
member.returns: An containing dashboard statistics including metrics and counts.
member.response: Returns the dashboard statistics successfully.
Unauthorized - User is not authenticated or lacks Admin role.

member.name: M:Project.Web.Controllers.AdminController.GetAuditLog
member.summary: Retrieves the complete audit log of administrative actions.
member.returns: An containing the list of all audit log entries.
member.response: Returns the audit log successfully.
Unauthorized - User is not authenticated or lacks Admin role.

member.name: M:Project.Web.Controllers.AdminController.GetPendingVerifications
member.summary: Retrieves all businesses that are pending verification.
member.returns: An containing the list of businesses awaiting admin review.
member.response: Returns the list of pending businesses successfully.
Unauthorized - User is not authenticated or lacks Admin role.

member.name: M:Project.Web.Controllers.AdminController.ReviewBusiness(System.Guid,Project.Core.DTO.ReviewBusinessDTO)
member.summary: Reviews a business verification request and approves or rejects it.
member.param: The unique identifier of the business to review.
The review decision containing approval status and optional admin notes.
member.returns: An indicating the result of the review operation.
member.response: Business reviewed successfully.
Bad request - Validation failed or business cannot be reviewed.
Unauthorized - User is not authenticated or lacks Admin role.
Business not found.
member.remarks: This endpoint validates the review data, extracts the admin ID from the authenticated user claims, and processes the business verification decision.

member.name: T:Project.Web.Controllers.BusinessController
member.summary: Controller for business-specific operations including onboarding and profile management.
member.remarks: This controller handles operations exclusive to business users, primarily the business onboarding process where businesses submit their details for admin verification.

member.name: M:Project.Web.Controllers.BusinessController.#ctor(Project.Core.ServiceContracts.IBusinessService,FluentValidation.IValidator{Project.Core.DTO.BusinessOnboardingDTO})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The service for handling business operations.
The validator for business onboarding data.

member.name: M:Project.Web.Controllers.BusinessController.SubmitOnboarding(Project.Core.DTO.BusinessOnboardingDTO)
member.summary: Submits business onboarding details for admin verification.
member.param: The business onboarding data including documents and images.
member.returns: A success response if the submission is valid and processed.
member.response: Business details submitted successfully and awaiting admin review.
If validation fails, required documents are missing, or business already exists.
If the user is not authenticated or lacks Business role.
If an internal server error occurs during submission.
member.remarks: This endpoint requires the user to have the "Business" role. The submitted data will be validated and stored for admin review. Required documents include business registration certificates and identification documents. The business account will be marked as "PendingVerification" until an admin approves or rejects it.

member.name: T:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController
member.summary: Mobile application authentication controller for handling customer authentication operations.
member.remarks: This controller provides endpoints for mobile app users (customers) including registration, login, email confirmation via deep links, password management, account deletion, and social login integration. It is specifically designed for mobile application authentication flows.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.#ctor(Project.Core.ServiceContracts.IAuthUsers,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The authentication service for user operations.
The application configuration.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.Register(Project.Core.DTO.RegisterDTO,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.IFormFile)
member.summary: Registers a new customer account for the mobile application.
member.param: The registration data for the customer.
Optional profile image file for the customer.
member.returns: A containing registration details and authentication token.
member.response: Returns the registration response with user details and token.
If model validation fails or registration data is invalid.
If an internal server error occurs.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.Login(Project.Core.DTO.LoginDTO)
member.summary: Authenticates a customer user for the mobile application.
member.param: The login credentials containing email and password.
member.returns: An containing user details and JWT token.
member.response: Returns the authentication response with token and user information.
If credentials are invalid.
If an internal server error occurs.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.RefreshToken(Project.Core.DTO.TokenDTO)
member.summary: Refreshes the JWT token using an expired access token and a valid refresh token.
member.param: The DTO containing the expired AccessToken and the RefreshToken.
member.returns: A new with new tokens.
member.response: Returns the new access and refresh tokens.
If the tokens are invalid or expired.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.ConfirmEmailRedirect(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Confirms a user's email address and redirects to the mobile app via deep link.
member.param: The unique identifier of the user.
The email confirmation token sent to the user's email.
member.returns: An HTML page that redirects to the mobile app with confirmation status.
member.response: Returns HTML content with deep link redirect.
If userId or token parameters are invalid.
member.remarks: This endpoint is designed for mobile deep linking. It returns an HTML page that automatically redirects to the mobile app using the configured URL scheme (e.g., hayy://confirm-email).

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.ForgotPassword(Project.Core.DTO.ForgotPasswordRequest)
member.summary: Initiates the password reset process by generating a reset token and sending it via email.
member.param: The request containing the user's email address.
member.returns: A success message indicating the reset link was sent if the email exists.
member.response: Returns success message (always returns success for security).
If an internal server error occurs.
member.remarks: For security reasons, this endpoint always returns success even if the email doesn't exist.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.ResetPasswordRedirect(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Redirects the user to the mobile app for password reset via deep link.
member.param: The user's email address.
The password reset token.
member.returns: An HTML page that redirects to the mobile app with reset parameters.
member.response: Returns HTML content with deep link redirect to reset password screen.
member.remarks: This endpoint is designed to be accessed from email links and redirects to the mobile app using a deep link containing the email and reset token.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.ResetPassword(Project.Core.DTO.ResetPasswordRequest)
member.summary: Resets a user's password using the provided reset token.
member.param: The request containing email, token, and new password.
member.returns: A success message if password is reset successfully.
member.response: Password reset successfully.
If validation fails or password reset fails.

member.summary: Changes the password for the currently authenticated user.

member.returns: A success message if password is changed successfully.
member.response: Password changed successfully.
If validation fails or password change fails.
If the user is not authenticated.

member.summary: Logs out the currently authenticated user.
member.returns: A success message if logout is successful.
member.response: User logged out successfully.
If the user is not authenticated.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.GetCurrentUser
member.summary: Retrieves the profile details of the currently logged-in user.
member.returns: A containing the user's profile information.
member.response: Returns the user profile data successfully.
If the user is not authenticated or token is invalid.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.DeleteAccount
member.summary: Permanently deletes the currently authenticated user's account.
member.returns: A success message if account deletion is successful.
member.response: Account deleted successfully.
If account deletion fails or user not found.
If the user is not authenticated.
If an internal server error occurs.
member.remarks: This operation is irreversible and will permanently delete all user data.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.AppAuthController.GoogleLogin(Project.Core.DTO.SocialLoginDTO)
member.summary: Authenticates a user using Google OAuth credentials for the mobile application.
member.param: The DTO containing Google authentication token and user information.
member.returns: An containing user details and JWT token.
member.response: Returns the authentication response with token and user information.
If the Google token is invalid or authentication fails.
member.remarks: This endpoint registers the user as a Customer type if they don't exist, or logs them in if they do.

member.name: T:WebApi.Controllers.NotificationsController
member.summary: Represents an API controller for managing user notifications, including creating new notifications, retrieving notifications for the current user, and marking notifications as read.
member.remarks: All endpoints in this controller require the caller to be authenticated. The controller is intended for use by authorized users only, and some actions (such as creating notifications) are typically performed by administrators or system processes. The current user's identity is determined from the authentication token rather than from request parameters, enhancing security by preventing spoofing of user IDs.

member.name: T:WebApi.Controllers.WebAuthController
member.summary: Web authentication controller for handling business and admin authentication operations.
member.remarks: This controller provides endpoints for business/admin registration, login, email confirmation, password management, and admin creation. It is designed for web-based authentication flows.

member.returns: A success message if the user is promoted successfully.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.WebAuthController.GoogleLogin(Project.Core.DTO.SocialLoginDTO)
member.summary: Authenticates a business user using Google OAuth credentials for web access.
member.param: The DTO containing Google authentication token and user information.
member.returns: An containing user details and JWT token.
member.response: Returns the authentication response with token and user information.
If the Google token is invalid or authentication fails.
member.remarks: This endpoint registers the user as a Business type if they don't exist, or logs them in if they do. Only Business accounts can use Google login through the web interface.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.WebAuthController.CheckEmailExists(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if an email is already registered in the system.
member.param: The email to check.
member.returns: An object indicating whether the email exists.
member.response: Returns true if email exists, otherwise false.
If email parameter is missing or invalid.
member.remarks: This endpoint is useful for client-side validation during registration to provide immediate feedback to users about email availability.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.WebAuthController.RevokeToken(Project.Core.DTO.RevokeTokenRequest)
member.summary: Revokes a specific refresh token, effectively logging out from a specific device.
member.param: The request containing the refresh token to revoke.
member.returns: A success message if the token is revoked successfully.
member.response: Token revoked successfully.
If token is missing, invalid, or not found.
member.remarks: This endpoint allows users to invalidate a specific refresh token, which is useful for logging out from a specific device or session. The token can be provided in the request body or in cookies.

member.name: M:WebApi.Controllers.WebAuthController.GetCurrentUser

If the user is not authenticated or token is invalid.

member.name: T:Program
member.summary: Auto-generated public partial Program class for top-level statement apps.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OpenApi.Generated.DocumentationCommentIdHelper.CreateDocumentationId(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates a documentation comment ID for a type. Example: T:Namespace.Outer+Inner`1 becomes T:Namespace.Outer.Inner`1

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OpenApi.Generated.DocumentationCommentIdHelper.CreateDocumentationId(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo)
member.summary: Generates a documentation comment ID for a property. Example: P:Namespace.ContainingType.PropertyName or for an indexer P:Namespace.ContainingType.Item(System.Int32)

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OpenApi.Generated.DocumentationCommentIdHelper.CreateDocumentationId(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a documentation comment ID for a property given its container type and property name. Example: P:Namespace.ContainingType.PropertyName

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OpenApi.Generated.DocumentationCommentIdHelper.CreateDocumentationId(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Generates a documentation comment ID for a method (or constructor). For example: M:Namespace.ContainingType.MethodName(ParamType1,ParamType2)~ReturnType M:Namespace.ContainingType.#ctor(ParamType)

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OpenApi.Generated.DocumentationCommentIdHelper.GetTypeDocId(System.Type,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates a documentation ID string for a type. This method handles nested types (replacing '+' with '.'), generic types, arrays, pointers, by-ref types, and generic parameters. The flag controls whether constructed generic type arguments are emitted, while controls whether the generic arity marker (e.g. "`1") is appended.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.OpenApi.Generated.DocumentationCommentIdHelper.NormalizeDocId(System.String)
member.summary: Normalizes a documentation comment ID to match the compiler-style format. Strips the return type suffix for ordinary methods but retains it for conversion operators.
member.param: The documentation comment ID to normalize.
member.returns: The normalized documentation comment ID.
